name: React Basics
description: Core React concepts and modern hooks

questions.question: What is React?
questions.answer: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces using components

questions.question: What is JSX?
questions.answer: JavaScript XML - syntax extension that allows writing HTML-like code in JavaScript

questions.question: What is the difference between state and props?
questions.answer: State is mutable data managed within a component, props are immutable data passed from parent to child

questions.question: What is the useState hook?
questions.answer: A hook that lets you add state to functional components: const [state, setState] = useState(initialValue)

questions.question: What is the useEffect hook used for?
questions.answer: Performs side effects in functional components (data fetching, subscriptions, DOM manipulation)

questions.question: What is the virtual DOM?
questions.answer: A lightweight copy of the actual DOM that React uses to efficiently update only changed elements

questions.question: What is prop drilling?
questions.answer: Passing props through multiple component levels to reach deeply nested components

questions.question: What is the useContext hook?
questions.answer: Hook to access context values without prop drilling, used for global state management
